intro: Sulcorebutia ambigua, commonly known as the desert rose or the sun rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny stems. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Sulcorebutia ambigua is well adapted to dry environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water and reduce transpiration. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
